ns0:service.annotation: !! MACRO name dhcp_server_voice_subnet !! Platform: ISR2951, ISR2921, ISR2911, ISR3925, ISR3945, Cat3750X, Cat3850, Cat3650 OS: !! Preconditions: !! Desc: Cisco devices can act as DHCP Servers. This example shows how to configure DHCP and some standard parameters for a Voice subnet in a scope. !! Usage: clean !! Tags: dhcp, options, pool, voice !! Vars: Only use "_" special characters in variable names !! $dhcp_pool_name: ; Descriptive name for the DHCP scope. !! $dhcp_ipv4_network_address: ; Network address for the DHCP IPv4 scope. !! $dhcp_ipv4_network_subnet_mask: ; Subnet mask of the network address for the DHCP IPv4 scope. !! $default_gateway_ipv4_address: ; Default gateway for the DHCP IPv4 scope. !! $dns_server1_ipv4_address: ; Primary DNS server for the DHCP scope. !! $dns_server2_ipv4_address: ; Secondary DNS server for the DHCP scope. !! $dhcp_domain_name: ; Domain name for the DHCP scope. !! $dhcp_lease_time_in_days: ; DHCP lease time in days for the scope. !! $cucm_1_ipv4_address: ; IPv4 address of the TFTP server within a CUCM cluster. Option 150 is used for Cisco phones to register to the call manager.
